title: Tail risk premiums versus pure alpha
description: Here, Yves Lempérière, Cyril Deremble, Trung-Tu Nguyen, Philip Seager, Marc Potters and Jean-Philippe Bouchaud present extensive evidence that risk premium is strongly correlated with tail-risk skewness but very little with volatility. They introduce a new, intuitive definition of skewness and elicit a linear relation between the Sharpe ratio of various risk premium strategies and their negative skewness. They find a clear exception to this rule: trend following that has positive skewness and positive excess returns, suggesting that some strategies are not risk premiums but genuine market anomalies. Based on their results, they propose an objective criterion to assess the quality of a risk-premium portfolio
